alert.note: Alert for Cochise; Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 6:25PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following counties, Cochise and Graham. * WHEN...Until 815 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 622 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms from the 1-10/ Highway 191 interchange north a few miles along highway 191. Up to 1.25" of rain has fallen. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northern Cochise and Southeastern Graham Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
